interestingFact: Japan consists of over 6,800 islands. It has more vending machines than any other country in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world. It has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
The Amazon Rainforest is mostly located in Brazil. Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people.It has the largest coral reef system in the world – the Great Barrier Reef.
Germany is known for its engineering and automotive industry. It has over 1,500 types of sausages.
India is the world's largest democracy. Chess and yoga originated in India.
Home to one of the oldest civilizations and the Great Pyramids. The Nile River runs through Egypt and is the longest river in the world.
France is the most visited country in the world. The Eiffel Tower was originally a temporary structure.
It has three capital cities. It’s known as the 'Rainbow Nation' due to its diverse cultures.
Norway is known for its stunning fjords. It consistently ranks high in global happiness and quality of life indexes.
